title: Web gui rendering issue on firefox when zoomed out - checkboxes

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
As you zoom out, firefox doesn't change the size of the checkbox / radio button, so they start to overlap, causing them to float next to each-other instead of directly below, this ruins the whole layout, making it impossible to see which checkbox relates to which label. It's a minor annoyance to me but the confusion could in theory result in someone giving the wrong device / person access to their files.

![syncthing_zoomed-out-firefox_rendering-problem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19378/5638065/40d8ab56-95fa-11e4-9ec4-5699e18aee31.png)

The float bootstrap adds to checkboxes and radio buttons is taking them out of the flow, so it no longer causes the containing div to provide enough height to allow the elements to sit on top of each other correctly without interfering with each-other.

The effect is exacerbated by 3-col layout in use causing the UI elements to scatter.

Here's a screenshot with the 3-cols disabled to clearly show the staggered effect of the floats when combined with zooming out on firefox:

![syncthing_inspect-floated-checkbox_cols-disabled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19378/5638124/08b08748-95fb-11e4-8720-40b151f0d852.png)

I should probably mention I'm on linux mint 17.1 as I think the widgets are different depending on the OS in use. Syncthing v 0.10.17

Hope that's helpful. I suggest using the overrides.css to disable the float as follows (I'll do a pull request for convenience in a moment).

```
.checkbox input[type="checkbox"], .radio input[type="radio"] {
    float: none;
}
```
